meanings.definition: A fossil bird of the late Jurassic period, having feathers and characteristics of both birds and reptiles.
meanings.sent1: The archaeopteryx was a fascinating discovery from the past.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the archaeopteryx to learn more about ancient birds.
meanings.sent3: The archaeopteryx must have been the trendsetter of its time with its unique features.
meanings.sent4: The archaeopteryx stands as a bridge between birds and reptiles in the history of evolution.
meanings.sent5: The archaeopteryx's fossil provides a glimpse into the ancient world of prehistoric creatures.

meanings.sent1: The archaeopteryx genus includes some of the most intriguing extinct birds.
meanings.sent2: Many paleontologists have dedicated their careers to studying the archaeopteryx genus.
meanings.sent3: In a fictional story, the archaeopteryx genus comes back to life and starts a bird revolution.
meanings.sent4: The archaeopteryx genus symbolizes the diversity and complexity of avian evolution.
meanings.sent5: The archaeopteryx genus represents a crucial chapter in the history of bird species.
